This guide is intended for scientists and technical staff in the DFO Pacific Region Science Branch. It outlines what is allowed, restricted, or prohibited when using internal and external platforms (e.g., SharePoint, GitHub, Zenodo, Google Drive) to manage and share DFO Science data, code, and metadata, including during Fisheries Science Advisory Report (FSAR) workflows.

For FSAR workflows, we recommend authors store data in the SharePoint site for the Pacific Salmon Data MS Team. All data should be accompanied by a data dictionary and README. GitHub can be used to host analysis code.

## üîê Data Classification Quick Reference

- **Unclassified**: No expected harm from disclosure. Includes open data, public metadata, and code that contains no sensitive logic or credentials.
  - _Examples_: Published R packages, fish counts aggregated by region and year, habitat model source code without raw data. Note, however, even unclassified data has to be approved for release by the Regional Director of Science.
- **Protected A**: Could cause low-level injury if disclosed (e.g., minor confidentiality breach, operational disruption).
  - _Examples_: Unpublished but non-sensitive biological metrics tied to location or project; fishing effort by vessel class if potentially re-identifiable; unreviewed site-specific model outputs.
- **Protected B**: Could cause serious injury if disclosed (e.g., violation of legal obligations, significant economic harm).
  - _Examples_: Commercial catch by vessel or license number; sensitive species occurrences; data provided under confidentiality agreements.

> üîó Refer to the [Policy on Government Security](https://www.tbs-sct.gc.ca/pol/doc-eng.aspx?id=32611) for classification definitions and examples.  
> üîé Unsure if data is protected? Consult your divisional data contact or ATIP office.

## üß≠ Platform-by-Platform Guidance

### ‚úÖ GitHub (Public and Private)
- **Recommended for**: Non-sensitive, unclassified code, metadata schemas, documentation, workflows.
- **Allowed**: Unclassified data/code only. Data must go through the approvals and internal publishing process before being posted publicly.
- **Private repos**: Use for drafting and collaboration before public release. Do not use for long-term data storage.
- **FSAR Guidance**: Releasing data in a public GitHub repo before approval by CSAS and before the release has been approved by the Regional Director of Science is a breach of the Access to Information Act and/or Privacy Act.

> üîó [TBS Directive on Open Government, Section 6.1](https://www.tbs-sct.gc.ca/pol/doc-eng.aspx?id=28108#cha6) ‚Äì Open information by default, subject to security/privacy.
> üîó [DFO Policy for Scientific Data](https://www.dfo-mpo.gc.ca/about-notre-sujet/publications/science/datapolicy-politiquedonnees/index-eng.html) - "it is the responsibility of the Regional Director of Science to designate specific Data as classified for preventing its open sharing."

---

### üö´ GitHub Codespaces / Copilot
- **Codespaces**: Cloud-hosted dev environments. Not GC-approved for sensitive data. Fine for non-sensitive code.
- **Copilot**: Do not enter Protected data/code. Avoid unless using for generic logic.

> üîó [TBS Guide on Generative AI](https://www.canada.ca/en/government/system/digital-government/digital-government-innovations/responsible-use-ai.html) 

---

### ‚úÖ Canadian Integrated Ocean Observing System, Zenodo, Dryad, Figshare
- Use **after FSAR or publication approval**.
- Good for creating DOIs and enabling citation and disseminating broadly.
- Data must be fully unclassified, reviewed, and approved.

---

### ‚úÖ GC Open Data Portal
- **Official repository** for open DFO datasets.
- Requires metadata, data steward approval, and Open Government Licence.

> üîó [Open Government Licence](https://open.canada.ca/en/open-government-licence-canada)  
> üîó [Open Data Publishing Guidance](https://open.canada.ca/en/using-open-data)

### üì§ Internal release process
- Managed by the Marine Spatial Data Infrastructure System and the Enterprise Data Hub
[Follow the official steps here](https://intranet.ent.dfo-mpo.ca/science/en/node/1478)

For steps specific to approvals and publishing, see Step 4 of the [Release Criteria Checklist](https://intranet.ent.dfo-mpo.ca/science/sites/science/files/release_criteria_checklist_open_government.pdf).


### ‚è≥ When to Release?
- **For FSAR-related data**: Only after advice is finalized and report is approved.
- **For code/metadata tools**: May be shared publicly once confirmed to contain no sensitive content.

> üîó [CSAS Procedural Manuals](https://www.dfo-mpo.gc.ca/csas-sccs/process-processus/index-eng.html) ‚Äì Supporting material must not be released until advice is finalized.
